text: was a after Kōshō and before Kanshō. This period started in September 1457 and ended in December 1460.Nussbaum, Louis-Frédéric. (2005). "Chōroku" in Japan encyclopedia, p. 122. During this time, the emperor was .Nussbaum, "Go- Hanazono Tennō," p. 252; Titsingh, Isaac. (1834). Annales des empereurs du japon, pp. 331-350. == Events of the Chōroku era == * 1458 (Chōroku 2, 8th month): The stolen Sacred Jewel was returned to the emperor.Titsingh, p. 349. * 1459 (Chōroku 3): Shogun Ashikaga Yoshimasa provided a new mikoshi and a complete set of robes as part of repairs to the Atsuta Shrine.Ponsonby-Fane, Richard. (1962). Studies in Shinto and Shrines, p. 452. ==Related pages == * Muromachi period == References == == Other websites == * National Diet Library, "The Japanese Calendar" -- historical overview plus illustrative images from library's collection Chōroku 1st 2nd 3rd 4th 1457 1458 1459 1460 Preceded by: Kōshō Era or nengō: Chōroku Succeeded by: Kanshō Category:Japanese eras
title: Chōroku
